DOC.brief_summary: This study investigates the clinical and neural effects of MBSR for young adults with childhood adversity. The investigators will recruit 60 young adults (19-35 years old) who will be randomized into a mindfulness based stress reduction(MBSR) program or a cognitive psychoeducation (CPE) program, both of which are 8 weeks long. MRI and psychological assessments will be acquired from all subjects before and after the intervention programs in order to investigate changes in clinical symptoms (such as depression, anxiety and stress) and hippocampus structure and function as well as other neural changes.
DOC.brief_title: Hippocampal Plasticity of Young Adults With Childhood Adversity After MBSR
DOC.criteria: having childhood adversity no history of psychiatric disorders of psychotic features or neurological disorders verified age between 1935 years old; no suicidal attempts during the past six months; being determined by the clinician to have the capability to comply with the program requirements and not detrimental to other participants in the group; passing common MRI exclusion criteria. no prior experience with MBSR or other systematic meditation programs; provided written informed consent to participate in this study; committed to meeting the requirement of refraining from using illicit drugs throughout the course of the study. psychosis active suicidal attempts during the past 6 months psychoactive substance abuse MRI exclusion criteria
